forecast.name: Columbus Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers and patchy fog. Cloudy, with a high near 57. Northeast wind around 22 mph, with gusts as high as 38 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers and patchy fog before 11pm, then patchy fog and showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy, with a low around 52. Northeast wind 15 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
As Boston settles into a gray embrace this Columbus Day, a steady veil of rain showers and patchy fog greets the weary traveler. The air hums with the chill of a northeastern wind, reminding us that autumn’s fingertips are yet unfurled. With temperatures hovering around a cool 57 degrees, the scenery offers little in the way of clarity, leaving the skyline shrouded and whispering secrets of the day ahead. Those venturing out will feel the playful gusts, so it’s wise to don a light, waterproof jacket, perhaps layered over a soft knit, to ward off the dampness that promises to linger.

As the evening descends, anticipation brews for more showers and perhaps a fleeting rumble of thunder. The low will settle around a cozy 52 degrees, echoing the muted color palette that blankets the city. In such weather, sipping a warm beverage at a local café while watching the world spill outside through fogged windows offers a tranquil reprieve. Or perhaps a leisurely stroll through familiar streets, umbrella in hand, to appreciate the quiet charm that only a rainy day can bring, as puddles form and the scent of wet earth mingles with the crisp autumn air. Today calls for moments of solace against life’s more raucous rhythms.
